member.name: T:LinqToExcel.Cell
member.summary: Represents a cell and its value in an excel spreadsheet

member.summary: Casts the cell's value to the generic argument type

member.summary: Allow cell to be implicitly cast to a string

member.summary: Cell's value

member.summary: Add a column to property mapping

Worksheet column name to map from

member.name: M:LinqToExcel.IExcelQueryFactory.AddMapping``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}},System.String,System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Add a column to property mapping with a transformation operation
member.typeparam: Class type to return row data as
member.param: Class property to map to
Worksheet column name to map from
Lambda expression that transforms a cell value in the spreadsheet to the desired property value

member.name: M:LinqToExcel.IExcelQueryFactory.AddTransformation``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}},System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Transforms a cell value in the spreadsheet to the desired property value
member.typeparam: Class type to return row data as
member.param: Class property value to transform
Lambda expression that transforms a cell value in the spreadsheet to the desired property value
member.example: AddTransformation{Person}(p => p.IsActive, x => x == "Y"); AddTransformation{Person}(p => p.IsYoung, x => DateTime.Parse(x) > new DateTime(2000, 1, 1));

member.name: P:LinqToExcel.IExcelQueryFactory.UsePersistentConnection
member.summary: If true, uses a single, persistent connection for the lifetime of the factory. If false, a new connection is created for each query Default is false

member.name: M:LinqToExcel.Query.ExcelQueryExecutor.ExecuteScalar``1(Remotion.Data.Linq.QueryModel)
member.summary: Executes a query with a scalar result, i.e. a query that ends with a result operator such as Count, Sum, or Average.

member.name: M:LinqToExcel.Query.ExcelQueryExecutor.ExecuteSingle``1(Remotion.Data.Linq.QueryModel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes a query with a single result object, i.e. a query that ends with a result operator such as First, Last, Single, Min, or Max.

member.name: M:LinqToExcel.Query.ExcelQueryExecutor.ExecuteCollection``1(Remotion.Data.Linq.QueryModel)
member.summary: Executes a query with a collection result.

member.summary: Executes the sql query and returns the data results
member.typeparam: Data type in the main from clause (queryModel.MainFromClause.ItemType)
member.param: Linq query model

member.summary: Full path to the Excel spreadsheet

member.name: P:LinqToExcel.ExcelQueryFactory.StrictMapping
member.summary: Confirms all the worksheet columns are mapped to a property, and if not, throws a StrictMappingException

member.name: P:LinqToExcel.ExcelQueryFactory.TrimSpaces
member.summary: Indicates how to treat leading and trailing spaces in string values.

member.name: P:LinqToExcel.ExcelQueryFactory.ReadOnly
member.summary: Opens the excel file in read-only mode

member.name: P:LinqToExcel.ExcelQueryFactory.DatabaseEngine
member.summary: Sets the database engine to use (Spreadsheets ending in xlsx, xlsm, and xlsb must use the Ace database engine) (If running 64 bit this defaults to ACE (JET doesn't work anyway), if running 32 bit this detaults to JET)

member.name: P:LinqToExcel.ExcelQueryFactory.UsePersistentConnection
member.summary: If true, uses a single, persistent connection for the lifetime of the factory. If false, a new connection is created for each query Default is false

member.name: M:LinqToExcel.Extensions.CommonExtensions.SetProperty(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value of a property
member.param: Name of the property
Value to set the property to

member.name: M:LinqToExcel.Extensions.CommonExtensions.CallMethod(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls a method
member.param: Name of the method
Method arguments

member.name: T:LinqToExcel.Query.StrictMappingType
member.summary: Class property and worksheet mapping enforcemment type.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.StrictMappingType.Both
member.summary: All worksheet columns must map to a class property; all class properties must map to a worksheet columm.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.StrictMappingType.ClassStrict
member.summary: All class properties must map to a worksheet column; other worksheet columns are ignored.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.StrictMappingType.None
member.summary: No checks are made to enforce worksheet column or class property mappings.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.StrictMappingType.WorksheetStrict
member.summary: All worksheet columns must map to a class property; other class properties are ignored.

member.name: T:LinqToExcel.Query.TrimSpacesType
member.summary: Indicates how to treat leading and trailing spaces in string values.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.TrimSpacesType.None
member.summary: Do not perform any trimming.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.TrimSpacesType.Start
member.summary: Trim leading spaces from strings.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.TrimSpacesType.End
member.summary: Trim trailing spaces from strings.

member.name: F:LinqToExcel.Query.TrimSpacesType.Both
member.summary: Trim leading and trailing spaces from strings.

member.summary: This method is visited when the LinqToExcel.Row type is used in the query

member.summary: Retrieves the column name from a member expression

member.summary: Retrieves the column name from a method call expression
